title: How to Download Videos for PSP

steps.headline: On a computer, go to a website that lets you download movies.
steps.description: IGN.com is a good one for video game lovers.

steps.headline: Download a video of your choice.
Using a USB cable, connect your PSP to your computer and enter USB mode.
steps.description: To do this, make sure the PSP is off to begin with, and turn it on once you are connected to the computer. Then, using your PSP, go to the SETTINGS menu, and press X to link the PSP to the computer. Now, when you go to "My Computer" you should see that an extra volume has been attached. On the far left of the screen, click on the button that says USB CONNECTION.

steps.headline: Open a PSP media transferring program.
steps.description: Media Boss is a good one.

steps.headline: Go to the videos section (make sure you saved the video where the program will look for it.)
'Select the video to upload and click 'Add To My PSP'.
Close Media Boss, exit USB mode, and unhook the USB cable (IN THAT ORDER!
steps.description: It helps keep from damaging your PSP).

steps.headline: Go to your videos.
steps.description: The video should be there (unless it is either unsupported or corrupted data).

text: On a computer, go to a website that lets you download movies. IGN.com is a good one for video game lovers. Download a video of your choice.  Using a USB cable, connect your PSP to your computer and enter USB mode. To do this, make sure the PSP is off to begin with, and turn it on once you are connected to the computer. Then, using your PSP, go to the SETTINGS menu, and press X to link the PSP to the computer. Now, when you go to "My Computer" you should see that an extra volume has been attached. On the far left of the screen, click on the button that says USB CONNECTION. Open a PSP media transferring program. Media Boss is a good one. Go to the videos section (make sure you saved the video where the program will look for it.)  'Select the video to upload and click 'Add To My PSP'.  Wait while it uploads.  Close Media Boss, exit USB mode, and unhook the USB cable (IN THAT ORDER! It helps keep from damaging your PSP). Go to your videos. The video should be there (unless it is either unsupported or corrupted data). Watch and enjoy!
